title: 109_s1481
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Indian Land Probate Reform Technical Corrections Act of 2005". It addresses the partition of highly fractionated Indian land. The Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to allow Indian tribes to purchase land within reservation boundaries or under tribal jurisdiction with consent of owners, requiring at least 50% consent for undivided interests. The Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to allow Indian tribes to include their interests in the computation of ownership percentage for land purchases within reservation boundaries or under tribal jurisdiction, with a requirement of at least 50% consent for undivided interests. In subclause (III), insert "(if any)" after "this section"; in subclause (IV), modify item (aa) by replacing "less" with "more" and item (bb) by replacing "to implement this section" with "under paragraph (5)"; in paragraph (5), change "shall" to "may". SEC. 3. TRIBAL PROBATE CODES. Amendment to Section 206 of the Indian Land Consolidation Act regarding the certification date and tribal agreements. SEC. 4. DESCENT AND DISTRIBUTION. Section 207 of the Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to redesignate subsections and specify the allotted land of specific Indian tribes identified in Federal law. The Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to specify allotted land of certain Indian tribes identified in Federal law, including restrictions on fee status for the Five Civilized Tribes and Osage Tribe. The Act applies to trust or restricted land and interests, with exceptions for specific Federal laws. The Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to update references to specific sections and subsections within the Act, including changes related to the American Indian Probate Reform Act of 2004. The Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to update references to specific sections and subsections within the Act, including changes related to the American Indian Probate Reform Act of 2004. The amendments involve redesignating subsections and updating references to subparagraphs within the Act. The Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to update references and sections related to the American Indian Probate Reform Act of 2004. Amendments include changes to how proceeds are held in trust and nontestamentary disposition rules. The Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to include provisions on joint tenancy and right of survivorship. Additionally, estate planning assistance now includes noncompetitive grants. SEC. 5. FRACTIONAL INTEREST ACQUISITION PROGRAM. Amends Section 213 of the Indian Land Consolidation Act to establish a Fractional Interest Acquisition Program. 

SEC. 6. ESTABLISHING FAIR MARKET VALUE. Amends Section 215 to govern amounts offered for the purchase of interests in trust or restricted land.

SEC. 7. LAND OWNERSHIP INFORMATION. Amends Section 217(e) to specify the availability of land ownership information.

SEC. 8. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Makes conforming amendments to the Indian Land Consolidation Act. SEC. 8. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends the American Indian Probate Reform Act of 2004 and the Act of June 18, 1934 regarding transfer and exchange of Indian land and shares. The section prohibits the transfer of restricted Indian land or shares without approval. It allows for transfer to the Indian tribe with the Secretary of the Interior's approval. Transferred land and shares follow the Indian Land Consolidation Act for descent or devise. The Indian Land Consolidation Act prohibits the transfer of restricted Indian land without approval. The Secretary of the Interior may authorize voluntary exchanges of land or shares for proper consolidation of Indian land. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as if included in the American Indian Probate Reform Act of 2004.
